alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 31 at 1:05PM MDT until April 02 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 9 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches over Marias Pass and in the higher terrain. Lower elevations can expect 1 to 2 inches, mainly Saturday evening through Sunday morning. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over Marias Pass and the higher terrain will cause blowing snow, reducing visibility. Lower elevations will see gusts 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...From 6 AM Saturday to 9 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
